translation: Now begins the description of the fifth Guru Tom Cat

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੇ ਚਲਾ ਦੱਤ ਮੁਨ ਰਾੲੀ || ਸੀਸ ਜਟਾ ਕੱਹ ਜੂਟ ਛਕਾੲੀ || ਦੇਖਾ ੲੇਕ ਬਿੜਾਲ ਜੁ ਅਾਗੇ || ਧਿਅਾਨ ਲਾੲਿ ਮੁਨਿ ਨਿਰਖਨ ਲਾਗੇ ||੧੮੫||
transliteration: Aage Chalaa Datt Mounndraaee|| Sees Jataa Jeet Chhakaaee|| Dekhaa Ek Bidaal Ju Aage|| Dhiaan Laae Mounndi) Nirkhan Laage||185||
translation: Dutt, the king of sages, having matted locks on his head, moved further; there he saw a Tom Cat, whom he continued ot scan attentively.185.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਸ ਕਾਜ ਜਸ ਲਾਵਤ ਧਿਅਾਨੂ || ਲਾਜਤ ਦੇਖ ਮਹੰਤ ਮਹਾਨੂ || ਅੈਸ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਹਰਿ ਹੇਤ ਲਗੱੲੀਅੈ || ਤਬ ਹੀ ਨਾਥ ਨਿਰੰਜਨ ਪੱੲੀਅੈ ||੧੮੬||
transliteration: Mous Kaaj Jas Laavat Dhiaanoo|| Laajat Dekh Mahant Mahaanoo|| Ais Dhiaan Har(i) Het Lagadoai|| Tab Hinaath Nitanjan Paooai||186||
translation: Seeing his miditativeness for the rats, even the great hermits felt shy; if such meditativeness is observed for the sake of the Lord, only then that unmanifested Brahman can be realized.186.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਚਮ ਗੁਰੂ ਯਾਹ ਹਮ ਜਾਨਾ || ਯਾ ਕਹੁ ਭਾਵ ਹੀਅੈ ਅਨੁਮਾਨਾ || ਅੈਸੀ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਜੋ ਲਾਵੈ || ਸੋ ਨਿਹਚੈ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਕੋ ਪਾਵੈ ||੧੮੭||
transliteration: Pancham Guroo Yaah Ham Jaanaa|| Uaa Kauh Bhaav Heeai Anoumaanaa|| Aisibhaant(i) Dhiaan Jo Laavai|| So Nihchai Saahib Ko Paavai||187||
translation: I shall consider him my fifth Guru, such a thought came to the mind of Dutt, the king of sages; he, who will meditate in such a way, he will assuredly realise the Lord.187.
End of the description of the adoption of Tom Cat as the fifth Guru.
Now begins the description of the Cotton Carder as the Guru

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗੇ ਚਲਾ ਰਾਜ ਸੰਨਯਾਸਾ || ੲੇਕ ਅਾਸ ਗਹਿ ਅੈਸ ਅਨਾਸਾ || ਤਹ ੲਿਕ ਰੂਮ ਧੁਨਖਤੋ ਲਹਾ || ਅੈਸ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਮਨ ਮੌ ਮੁਨ ਕਹਾ ||੧੮੮||
transliteration: Aage Chalaa Raaj Sannyaasaa|| Ek Aas Gadh Ais Anaasaa|| Tah Ik Room Dhounakhto Lahaa|| Ais Bhaant(i) Man Sau Mounndkahaa||188||
translation: Leaving all other desires and keeping only one thought in his mind, Dutt, the king of Yogis moved further; there he saw a carder carding cotton and said thus in hiss mind;188.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਪ ਸੈਨ ੲਿਹ ਜਾਤ ਨ ਲਹੀ || ਗ੍ਰੀਵਾ ਨੀਚ ਨੀਚ ਹੀ ਰਹੀ || ਸਗਲ ਸੈਨ ਵਾਹੀ ਮਗ ਗੲੀ || ਤਾਕੌ ਨੈਕ ਖਬਰ ਨਹੀ ਭੲੀ ||੧੮੯||
transliteration: Bhoop Sain Eh Jaat Na Ahee|| Greevaa Neech Neech Hirahee|| Sagad Sain Vaahimag Gade|| Taakau Naik Khabar Nahibhaee||189||
translation: “This man has not seen all the army passing in front of him and his neck remained bowed; the whole army went on this path, but he was not conscious of that.”189.

gurmukhi: ਰੂੲੀ ਧੁਨਖਤੋ ਫਿਰ ਨ ਨਿਹਾਰਾ || ਨੀਚ ਹੀ ਗ੍ਰੀਵਾ ਰਹਾ ਬਿਚਾਰਾ || ਦੱਤ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਹੀੲੇ ਮੁਸਕਾਨਾ || ਖਸ਼ਟਮ ਗੁਰੂ ਤਿਸੀ ਕਹੁ ਜਾਨਾ ||੧੯੦||
transliteration: Rooidhounakhto Phir Na Nihaaraa|| Neech Higrivaa Rahaa Bichaaraa|| Datt Bilok Heee Mouskaanaa|| Khashtam Guroo Tisikauh Jaanaa||190||
translation: While carding the cotton, he did not look back and this lowly person kept his neck bowed; seeing him, Dutt smiled in his mind and said, “I accept him as my sixth Guru.”190.

gurmukhi: ਰੂਮ ਹੇਤ ੲਿਹ ਜਿਮ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾਯੋ || ਸੈਨ ਗੲੀ ਪਰੁ ਸਿਰ ਨ ੳੁਚਾਯੋ || ਤੈਸੀੲੇ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਸੋ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਲਗੱੲੀਅੈ || ਤਬ ਹੀ ਪੁਰਖ ਪੁਰਾਤਨ ਪੱੲੀਅੈ ||੧੯੧||
transliteration: Room Het Eh Jim Chit(u) Laayo|| Sain Gadpar(u) Sir Na Ouchadyo|| Taiseee Prabh So Preet Lagadeeeai|| Tab Hipurakh Puraatan Pueeeeau||191||
translation: The way in which he absorbed his mind in cotton and the army passed away and he did not raise his head, in the same way, when the Lord will be loved, then that ancient Purusha i.e. the Lord will be realized.191.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਰੂੲੀ ਧੁਨਖਤਾ ਪੇਂਜਾ ਖਸ਼ਟਮੋ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਮਾਪਤੰ ||੬||
transliteration: It(i) Rooidhounakhtaa Penjaa Khashtamo Guroo Samaaptan||6||
translation: End of the description of the adoption of Carder as the sixth Guru.
